Package renderer

Class RenderThread

java.lang.Object
renderer.RenderThread
public class RenderThread
extends java.lang.Object
Class which create the color matrix of the image from the scene

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    private static class  RenderThread.Pixel
    Helper class to represent a pixel to draw in a multithreading rendering.
    static class  RenderThread.RenderBuilder
    Builder Pattern, by this class we are updating the parent class (Render), instance that we are interested in creating even before we create it

      private RenderThread​(RenderThread.RenderBuilder renderBuilder)
      Private CTOR of the class built by Builder Pattern only
      Parameters:
      renderBuilder - A virtual entity of the class we are currently implementing

  • Method Details

    • renderImage

      public void renderImage()
      For all the pixels of the ViewPlane, a ray will be built, and for each ray we will get a color from the ray's tracer. We will put the color in the appropriate pixel of the image maker (using method writePixel)
      Throws:
      java.util.MissingResourceException - if not all fields a non-empty value was entered

    • printGrid

      public void printGrid​(int interval, Color color)
      A method to create a grid of lines
      Parameters:
      interval - Indicates for which quantity of pixels a grid line is passed, both horizontally and vertically
      color - the grid's color
      Throws:
      java.util.MissingResourceException - if imageWriter is null

    • writeToImage

      public void writeToImage()
      Activates (delegate!) The appropriate image maker's method
      Throws:
      java.util.MissingResourceException - if imageWriter is null

    • printPercent

      private int printPercent​(int currentPixel, int pixels, int lastPercent)
      Prints the progress in percents only if it is greater than the last time printed the progress.
      Parameters:
      currentPixel - the index of the current pixel
      pixels - the number of pixels in the image
      lastPercent - the percent of the last time printed the progress
      Returns:
      If printed the new percent, returns the new percent. Else, returns lastPercent.
